page.title: 01BROMPTON
page.content: Brompton SE 3796 is a dormitory village for Northallerton, 2km.S (where most of its amenities are) and for commuters to Teesside, 30km. NE. It stretches 5km. N to S and 3km. from E to W. Brompton is two centred; High Green round the church and Water End.A Roman road forms an eastern boundary and the River Wiske the western.It is a rich area of mixed farming.The York/Teesside railway line bisects it SSE to NNW.The A684 road S to E and a'B'road SSE to NNW. There are 1649 electors in the Parish which is represented on the Northallerton Town Council and Hambleton District Council which is part of North Yorkshire. Brompton is in the Parliamentary constituency of Richmondshire.
